message:
SYSTEM: PROLEGintro_eng_long.pdf: Página 45
Examples of PROLEG semantics
Example 1 Let P1 = {H1, E1} and H1 be the following set of
rules:
P <=.
Q <=.
R <=.
and E1 be the following set of exceptions:
exception(P,Q).
exception(Q,R).
Let M1 = {P,R}. Then, since HM1 = {P <=. R<=.} and M1 =
min(HM1), M1 is an extension.
Let M′1 = {Q}. Then, since HM′! = {Q <=. R<=.} and M′1 ̸=
min(HM′1), M′1 is not an extension.
45
speaker: SYSTEM
